Description: Rectangular sycomore fig wood box with four feet and a vaulted sliding lid; covered with ivory strips decorated with annules(except one which has incised cross-hatched decoration) and attached by small plugs; between the ivory strips there were originally strips of ebony(most now missing); at one end are two knobs(one missing) to which the fastening cord was attached.
Curator's comments: Published: For similar pieces of MK date, see: Junker, El-Kubanieh Nord (Vienna, 1920), Blatt 24, p.153. Posener, A Dictionary of Egyptian Civilization, (Methuen, 1962), p.97.
